text: Haedropleura hanleyi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Horaiclavidae. It was previously included within the family Turridae. It is species inquirenda. It is spurious taxon, of which no types could be traced and it may be a species of Propebela. ==Description== ==Distribution== This species occurs in the English Channel off France. ==References== This article incorporates CC-BY-SA-3.0 text from the referenceGofas, S.; Tucker, J. (2010). Haedropleura forbesi Locard, 1892. Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=433988 on 2011-09-16 ==External links== * * Tucker, J.K. 2004 Catalog of recent and fossil turrids (Mollusca: Gastropoda). Zootaxa 682:1-1295. hanleyi
title: Haedropleura hanleyi
